name: Max Correct Set
statement: Let's call the set of positive integers $$$S$$$ correct if the following two conditions are met: $$$S \subseteq \{1, 2, \dots, n\}$$$; if $$$a \in S$$$ and $$$b \in S$$$, then $$$|a-b| \neq x$$$ and $$$|a-b| \neq y$$$. For the given values $$$n$$$, $$$x$$$, and $$$y$$$, you have to find the maximum size of the correct set.
inputFormat: A single line contains three integers $$$n$$$, $$$x$$$ and $$$y$$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 10^9$$$; $$$1 \le x, y \le 22$$$).
outputFormat: Print one integer â€” the maximum size of the correct set.
